DataElement.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Greater Than 95 Percent Dose Exposure Percent Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to describe the percentage of the planning target volume (PTV) of tissue exposed to more than 95% of a radiotherapy dose.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Greater Than 95 Percent Dose Exposure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::95_A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.

Concepts.definition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than Integer::95 Percentage Dose Exposure
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::95:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time. :Contact with infectious agents (bacteria or viruses) in a manner that promotes transmission and increases the likelihood of disease. (CDC)

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Planning Target Volume Dose Percentage Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The precise outlining of an anatomic region for the purpose of delivering a high dose of radiotherapy to that concentrated area, and at the same time, minimizing the exposure and potential side effects of the adjacent tissues.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CTEP Text 1
